articles.title: A Tom and Jerry movie gets a hopeful plan for release in theaters next year
articles.description: Tom and Jerry have been trying to kill each other for 80 years -- and now, they'll continue that tradition in a new movie scheduled for release in theaters in 2021.

articles.title: Senate Republicans fail to advance controversial Fed nominee Judy Shelton
articles.description: The Republican-led Senate on Tuesday failed to get enough votes to break a filibuster of Judy Shelton, President Donald Trump's controversial nominee for the Federal Reserve.

articles.title: Pennsylvania Supreme Court rules Trump campaign observers had no right to stand within a specific distance during Philadelphia ballot processing

articles.author: Ashley Strickland, CNN
articles.title: 'Dueling dinosaurs' fossils show Triceratops, T. rex, may have died after a battle
articles.description: About 67 million years ago, a Triceratops horridus and a Tyrannosaurus rex died and were quickly buried together side by side in a single grave. It's the kind of showdown scientists have speculated about for years. And the fossils will go on dislay in 2022.

articles.author: Scottie Andrew and Giulia Heyward,
articles.title: Almost 1 in 10 transgender Americans use nonprescribed hormones because they're uninsured or insurance won't cover the cost
articles.description: For the transgender people who seek it, gender-affirming hormone therapy can be lifesaving. But if they're uninsured or their insurance won't cover it, some bypass the health care system entirely to get the care they need.

articles.title: How Lindsey Graham became Trump's self-appointed election enforcer
